intro: Echites latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
